text:
Hi folks! I'm Ebi, a Content Strategist at the Singapore-based agency <http://withcontent.co|With Content>  We call ourselves a content marketing agency, but recently I've been wondering how well that term applies since so much of our work is limited to production (i.e., we rarely get to look into clients' backends/GA to see results and create better content). Right now, I'm trying to figure out how we can improve our processes, more clearly define our direction, and learn from highly talented content marketers to improve my writing craft.

I'm actually from Indonesia, so if you have questions about vacationing here or great places to visit, feel free to ask away :slightly_smiling_face: I'd also be more than happy to connect on <https://linkedin.com/in/ebi|LinkedIn>!

attachments.title: Home
attachments.text: A content marketing agency in Singapore that helps B2B tech companies attract, engage, and convert potential customers sustainably.
attachments.fallback: With Content | Content Marketing Agency: Home

text: Hello! Not all of our members are guys. In an effort to be more conscious of the language we use to address each other, why not try “Hey, folks,” or “Hey everyone” instead?
